countries.diaryEntry: The Motherland. Born and raised here for the first 10 years of my life. Will forever be my home although I'm far. People's kindness and tenacity for life is unmatched here.
One of the coolest places on Earth. I especially love the Japanese countryside where its calm and serenity give me life. It makes sense that people live longer here
Went for the first time for Abe's birthday in 2019. Ended up meeting the love of my life.

Visited Thaer here in Feb 2020...right before COVID went into full effect and the world shut down. He was in Amman on a Fullbright scholarship. Ate the best falafels in the world, went to Temple of Hercules, walked the salty beaches of the Dead Sea, haggled in the street markets, and visited castles that go back to the time of the Romans.

March 2014. Went to London for a week to study Public Health. Modern meets Medieval. Leeds Castle was super cool. Food was...nothing to write about. It's a bustling city and walking everywhere got tiring. The museums are great until you realize almost all of these treasures should really go back to where they're from...

Went here Feb 2019 right after visiting Thaer in Amman. I met with Joana here. It would be the first time I would see her after meeting her in Portugal. We visited the Louvre, went up the Eiffel Tower, went to a few museums, saw a live Jazz band playing, and ate food from around the world. This was where she first tried falafel and fell in love with it. This was also where she ate pho for the first time. What an unforgettable time I've had here with Joana.
